title: E-Commerce Platform
summary: A full-featured online store with product catalog, cart, checkout, and admin dashboard.

content.background: The client needed a scalable e-commerce solution to handle high traffic during sales events.
responsibilities: Architected the microservices backend for scalability.
Implemented secure payment processing integration with Stripe.
Built a responsive and performant frontend using Next.js.
results: Successfully handled 10k+ concurrent users during launch.
Increased conversion rate by 15% through optimized checkout flow.
Reduced page load time to under 1.5s.
tradeoffs: Chose PostgreSQL over NoSQL for strict transactional consistency.
Used server-side rendering for critical pages to boost SEO.

title: Task Management App
summary: A collaborative task management tool for teams, featuring real-time updates and drag-and-drop boards.

content.background: Remote teams needed a simple yet powerful tool to track project progress.
responsibilities: Developed the drag-and-drop Kanban board interface.
Integrated real-time data synchronization using Firebase.
Designed a mobile-friendly layout for on-the-go access.
results: Adopted by 5 internal teams within the first month.
Received positive feedback for intuitive UX and responsiveness.
Zero downtime during the first 6 months of operation.
tradeoffs: Used Firebase for rapid development, accepting vendor lock-in as a tradeoff.
Prioritized core features over complex permissions for MVP.

title: Portfolio Generator
summary: A static site generator for developers to showcase their work, built with performance and SEO in mind.

content.background: Many developers struggle to build a portfolio from scratch. This tool simplifies the process.
responsibilities: Designed the configuration schema for easy customization.
Implemented the build pipeline to generate optimized HTML.
Wrote comprehensive documentation and usage guides.
results: Used by 100+ developers to build their personal sites.
Featured in 'Top Developer Tools' weekly newsletter.
tradeoffs: Focused on developer experience (CLI) rather than a GUI.
Limited themes initially to ensure high quality of the default one.
